message_1: Consider a transposition cipher in which each letter of the message is shifted two positions to the right. If the original message was "MATHEMATICS", what is the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a transposition cipher with a shift of two positions to the right, we will replace each letter with the letter that is two positions ahead of it in the alphabet. If we reach the end of the alphabet, we will wrap around to the beginning.

M -> O
A -> C
T -> V
H -> J
E -> G
M -> O
A -> C
T -> V
I -> K
C -> E
S -> U

So, the encrypted message is "OCVGJOCVKEU".
